p: Because ACE-2, the receptor necessary for virus uptake, is expressed in the cardiovascular system ( 33), it is expected that this tissue is also susceptible to SARS-CoV-2 infection. Some new studies showed that COVID induces a vascular process in the lung, which includes vasodilation and endothelial dysfunction ( 34). In this regard, Caruso et al. ( 35) observed subsegmental vascular enlargement via computer tomography of patients with COVID-19. The presence of thrombosis or acute pulmonary embolism in COVID-19 patients associated with increased respiratory dead space was also reported by Chen et al. ( 36).
